page.title: 10Blockley Mills
page.content: Mr Cooks house used to be a corn mill in 1923.The mill was run by a wheel which ran on water.The water would run on the wheel and make it turn. The water came from Blockley Brook.The mill was converted into a house in 1926 by a Mr Woodsy.He sold it to Mr Cooks father in 1931 and Mr Cook got it in 1960. There are many signs of a mill but the best ones are the mill stones. The mill stopped working in 1937. At one time there were 15 fully working mills in Blockley. This is because there are so many underground springs which were used to drive the mills.
